turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Saudi Arabian-led intervention in Yemen.
turn.1: What happened in the Battle of Aden?
turn.2: The Battle of Aden came to an end with pro-Hadi forces again seized control of Aden port and moving into the city's commercial center.
turn.4: On 22 July, pro-Hadi forces had retaken full control of Aden, and the Aden Airport was reopened.
turn.6: In late July, an offensive launched by pro-Hadi forces drove Houthi forces out of the towns neighboring Aden.
turn.8: On 4 September a Houthi OTR-21 Tochka missile hit an ammunition dump at a military base in Safer in Ma'rib Governorate killing 52 UAE, 10 Saudi and 5 Bahraini soldiers.
turn.10: The Safer base was being built up by coalition forces for a push against Sanaa.
turn.12: "It was the deadliest single attack on coalition soldiers since the start of its operation against Houthi rebels in March " Asseri said. The attacked was the highest casualty loss in the history of the UAE military.
